creator: fulton@cmu.edu
text:
I would be good idea to add explanatory text to the administration pages. Currently, there are only 
menus and buttons with no clear indication of what one is doing or what the result of a button/action 
will be. For example, the difference between a reviewer, editor or admin is a bit of a mystery. While that 
information might be available elsewhere (?) it would be good HCI to have it right where it's needed.

creator: gregor@apache.org
text:
can you provide a bit more details of what kind of info you'd like to see? group
meanings can differ since you can create arbitrary groups. it may make sense to
add a widget to lenya to selectively allow help rollovers. maybe this makes most
sense to be implemented with cforms?

creator: fulton@cmu.edu
text:
(In reply to comment #1)

On the first page is simply the heading 'Administration' with nothing else on the page. Even one or two 
paragraphs of descriptive text would help.

Similarly, the User, Groups etc. pages need some exposition. As it stands now there is no indication of 
what a user is to do here or any indication of the effect doing something here. The sections (User, 
Groups etc) don't even correspond to sections in the documentation. In fact, 'Groups' are called 'Roles' 
in the documentation, further confusing the meaning of either.

The default groups/roles (admin, editor, reviewer) should be explained.

> In fact, 'Groups' are called 'Roles'
> in the documentation, further confusing the meaning of either.

Can you show me where? Groups and Roles are totally different things.
creator: andreas@apache.org
fulton@cmu.edu
text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> > In fact, 'Groups' are called 'Roles'
> > in the documentation, further confusing the meaning of either.
> 
> Can you show me where? Groups and Roles are totally different things.

On: http://lenya.apache.org/docu.html

Under 'Components' it lists roles and gives examples such as editor, reviewer etc. The 'Groups' in the 
default Lenya installation have similar names. Again, this is why I was confused. There's no definition of  
groups in the documentation. At the same time, there's no page for editing Roles.

Maybe, I'm just coming in to Lenya too soon and should wait for 1.4 or 2.0? It seems that all this might 
make sense to a developer but is not ready for users. I feel like I'm wasting your time with nitpicks.

the administration pages are a lot easier to grok now. please reopen if you
